str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
